content:
The previous bug was on our end. I fixed it and I pushed the fix to the latest commit and I updated the interop doc.

I ran into another odd behavior. This one is geth returning `INVALID_BLOCK_HASH` on `NewPayloadV1`. Reason:
```
blockhash mismatch, want c6f474a6a47d6846d56bbdba906b91cf5a01e5145626febef06dbff70345764f, got 18aa04050395fd4664f75f85c0825b918b88418d2569b670a145528640516a7d"
```

Although I can confirm that the right hash was received via:
```
Engine API request received              method=ExecutePayload number=6 hash=c6f474..45764f
```

I updated the interop doc to reflect this odd case. Lmk if I'm missing anything obvious ğŸ™
